column4: hey guys, how do I update a package that I've already installed?  amaroK 1.4 just came out .
either find an unofficial deb, or build it from source
There's no like... apt-get update or something?
no. ubuntu is a 'stable' distro, and does not promise to run the latest & greatest.
but don't count on it. But, someone will create an unofficial deb if ubuntu doesn't.
sorry, but you will probably have troubles finding someone here to troubleshoot that, the ubuntu drivers get support here
most of the kde enabled people hang out in #kubuntu
It seems like a kernel issue, rather than a KDE issue.  But I will ask in #kubuntu too.
I haven't tested it.  I have no way to reproduce it, and I do all my work in KDE, so I haven't installed GNOME.
ok. it could be that you found the kde related stuff simply by chance, or because you're gnome deprived. I just noticed that all your info was kde related
it's simply telling you the technique it's using to access the usb.
fyrestrtr : Well, first off, it's not actually mounting anything.  Second off, why does it need SCSI?  SCSI is older than the hills.
why it's not mounting is another question, but what's wrong with scsi ?
fyrestrtr: Well, fair enough.  I was under the impression that SCSI was just a deprecated standard.  But if it's supposed to work, sure.  Now, howcome it isn't mounting?
fyrestrtr : When I manually mount it, it works fine.  It doesn't seem to be able to mount it automatically, though.
I formatted it to ext3 using gparted.
I don't know anything about how kde does automounting
